intro: Coccothrinax guantanamensis, commonly known as the Guantánamo palm, is a species of palm native to the island of Cuba. It is characterized by its slender, multi-stemmed trunk and pinnate leaves that are typically dark green and glossy. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that develop into clustered, sweet-smelling fruits. It thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and arid conditions. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is a notable species in Cuban flora.
